amendment.description: To protect the American people from terrorist attacks by providing the necessary resources to our firefighters, police, EMS workers and other first-responders by restoring $1,626 billion in cuts to first-responder programs.

vote.text: Amendment SA 147 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 46 - 54. Record Vote Number: 50.

action.text: Amendment SA 147 proposed by Senator Stabenow. (consideration: CR S2678-2680, S2693-2694; text: CR S2679) To protect the American people from terrorist attacks by providing the necessary resources to our firefighters, police, EMS workers and other first-responders by restoring $1,626 billion in cuts to first-responder programs.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Amendment SA 147 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 46 - 54. Record Vote Number: 50.
Senate amendment not agreed to: Amendment SA 147 not agreed to in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 46 - 54. Record Vote Number: 50.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 147 proposed by Senator Stabenow.
